SENT.plain: X-linked lymphoproliferative disease is characterized by immune deficiency, particularly to the Epstein-Barr virus and by a tendency to develop fatal infectious mononucleosis, acquired hypogammaglobulinaemia or malignant lymphoma
This disorder has been diagnosed in three boys, two brothers and a maternally related cousin, residing in Australia
The proband presented at 6 years of age with fulminating infectious mononucleosis
His 9 year old male cousin had developed an ileal Burkitt lymphoma one year earlier
Immunological and molecular genetic evidence is presented to support our view that his younger sibling is also affected with this condition
DNA linkage studies using probes to DXS10 and DXS37 provide confirmatory evidence for the diagnosis in the proband's brother and information on carrier status in female family members
